    Bridge between model and facade

      /load Clears all data from the database (just like the /clear API), and then loads the posted user, person, and event data into the database.

      • truncateDatabase

        public HTTPResponse truncateDatabase()
        /clear Deletes ALL data from the database, including user accounts, auth tokens, and generated person and event data..
        Returns:
        HTTPResponse containing response body with a message of success or failure

      • generateDataForUser

        public HTTPResponse generateDataForUser(HTTPRequest request)
        /fill/[username]/{generations} Populates the server's database with generated data for the specified user name. The required "username" parameter must be a user already registered with the server. If there is any data in the database already associated with the given user name, it is deleted. The optional “generations” parameter lets the caller specify the number of generations of ancestors to be generated, and must be a non-negative integer (the default is 4, which results in 31 new persons each with associated events).
        Parameters:
        request - with params containing username and generations.
        Returns:
        HTTPResponse containing response body with a message of success or failure

      • truncateFill

        public HTTPResponse truncateFill(HTTPRequest request)
        /load Clears all data from the database (just like the /clear API), and then loads the posted user, person, and event data into the database.
        Parameters:
        request - with body containing arrays of users, persons, and events to be created
        Returns:
        HTTPResponse containing response body with a message of success or failure

      • getPerson

        public HTTPResponse getPerson(HTTPRequest request)
        /person/[personID] Returns the single Person object with the specified ID.
        Parameters:
        request - with url parameter of person id
        Returns:
        HTTPResponse with body containing a user object

      • getFamilyMembers

        public HTTPResponse getFamilyMembers()
        /person Returns ALL family members of the current user. The current user is determined from the provided auth token.
        Returns:
        HTTPResponse containing array of Person Objects

      • getEvent

        public HTTPResponse getEvent()
        /event/[eventID] Returns the single Event object with the specified ID.
        Returns:
        HTTPResponse with body containing a event object

      • getAllEventsOfFamilyMembers

        public HTTPResponse getAllEventsOfFamilyMembers()
        /event Returns ALL family members of the current user. The current user is determined from the provided auth token.
        Returns:
        HTTPResponse containing array of Event Objects
